title.narrative: Agricultural Development: Smallholder Plantations Entrepreneurship Development Programme

description.narrative: The goal of the programme is the improvement of the livelihoods and social conditions of estate workers and smallholder estate crop producers on a sustainable basis. It aims to: (a) enable estate workers and smallholders to develop sustainable outgrower systems with nucleus estates and downstream processing enterprises; and (b) promote and consolidate effective partnerships between the target group and the private and public sectors. The programme objectives are: (a) intended beneficiaries strengthen their institutional capacity and negotiation skills; (b) estate workers and smallholder tea and rubber growers improve their land tenure and develop profitable and sustainable outgrower/smallholder farming systems; (c) producers obtain increased profits through improved post-harvest handling, storage, processing and marketing of their products; and (d) rural finance and credit services developed and expanded.

name.narrative: Agricultural Development: Smallholder Plantations Entrepreneurship Development Programme

description.narrative: This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
